intro: Hieracium anfractum subsp. luebeckii, commonly known as the Lübeck hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and roadsides. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. This subspecies is noted for its variable morphology and is often found in association with other members of the Hieracium genus.
